availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Jesse G. Sweeney (Garrard County, Kentucky, merchant)

body.p: Garrard County, Kentucky, merchant. Kentucky native. Married to Elizabeth Ann Wilkinson in Casey County on November 17, 1850. Father of Charles W. Sweeney, William O. Sweeney, Kate Sweeney, Biddy Sweeney, and Jennie Sweeney. Merchant in Garrard County in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Casey County, District 2, p. 287B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Garrard County, Lancaster, p. 5.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Garrard County, Lancaster, p. 63.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Garrard County, Lancaster, p. 1.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Casey County Marriages, Film #000907997, p. 69.
Find A Grave, "Jesse G Sweeney (1827-1907)," Memorial #88662622, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/88662622 (accessed May 4, 2020).
